Class Level3

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameLoop
      • Level3

  • public class Level3
extends GameLoop
    Initializes the proper background and scene for Level3.

    References:
    Dillon, A. (2015). Picasso (Version 2) [Software]. Retrieved from https://github.com/Hopding/Picasso.

    Since:
    1.1
    Version:
    1.11

    1.1 - Julia Xie
    Date: 2019/05/28
    Time Spent: 5 minutes
    Created class.

    1.2 - Julia Xie
    Date: 2019/05/29
    Time Spent: 30 minutes
    Added constructor.
    Added initBackground() method.
    Added initStage() method.

    1.11 - Julia Xie
    Date: 2019/06/08
    Time Spent: 2 hours
    Modified initBackground() method.

    Author:
    Julia Xie

    • Constructor Detail

      • Level3

        public Level3(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage,
              boolean scrollable,
              int width,
              int height,
              int scene,
              int flowSceneNum,
              boolean hasHomework,
              boolean hasPlates,
              boolean hasTrash,
              boolean playedGames)
        Constructor for Level3. Calls the constructor of the superclass and sets the width and height of the stage.
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - the stage which the scene appears on
        scrollable - whether or not the scene can be scrolled
        width - the width of the stage
        height - the height of the stage
        scene - the scene number
        flowSceneNum - the number of scene changes
        hasHomework - whether or not the level has homework
        hasPlates - whether or not the level has plates
        hasTrash - whether or not the level has trash
        playedGames - whether or not the player is playing games
        Since:
        1.3

      • initBackground

        public void initBackground(int sceneNum)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Initializes the background with a picture or colour. Sets constraints based on the scene number.

        1.11 - Julia Xie
        Added a "a few months later" fade in screen.

        Specified by:
        initBackground in class GameLoop
        Parameters:
        sceneNum - the scene number
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an input or output exception occurs when looking for an image
        Since:
        1.2
